qas.question: In what year did the CIA establish its first training facility?
What was the name of the first training facility that was established by the CIA?

answers.text: the Office of Training and Education

qas.question: What event decreased the CIA's training budget?
Who was the Director of Central Intelligence in 2002?
How many annual courses does the CIA University have?

context: The CIA established its first training facility, <a1_0>the Office of Training and Education<a1_0/>, in <a0_0>1950<a0_0/>. Following the end of <a2_0>the Cold War<a2_0/>, the CIA's training budget was slashed, which had a negative effect on employee retention. In response, Director of Central Intelligence <a3_0>George Tenet<a3_0/> established CIA University in 2002. CIA University holds <a4_0>between 200 and 300<a4_0/> courses each year, training both new hires and experienced intelligence officers, as well as CIA support staff. The facility works in partnership with the National Intelligence University, and includes the Sherman Kent School for Intelligence Analysis, the Directorate of Analysis' component of the university.
